entries.title: As AI data centers hit power limits, Peak XV backs Indian startup C2i to fix the bottleneck
entries.content: C2i has raised $15 million as it tests a grid-to-GPU approach to reducing power losses in AI data centers.
entries.author: Jagmeet Singh

entries.title: Blackstone backs Neysa in up to $1.2B financing as India pushes to build domestic AI infrastructure
entries.content: Neysa is targeting deployments of more than 20,000 GPUs over time as demand for local AI compute accelerates.
entries.author: Jagmeet Singh

entries.title: OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger joins OpenAI
entries.content: OpenAI said OpenClaw will live on as an open source project.
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: Longtime NPR host David Greene sues Google over NotebookLM voice
entries.content: The longtime host of NPR’s “Morning Edition,” is suing Google, alleging that the male podcast voice in the company’s NotebookLM tool is based on him.
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: Anthropic and the Pentagon are reportedly arguing over Claude usage
entries.content: The apparent issue: whether Claude can be used for mass domestic surveillance and autonomous weapons.
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: India has 100M weekly active ChatGPT users, Sam Altman says
entries.content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says India has the largest number of student users of ChatGPT worldwide.
entries.author: Jagmeet Singh

entries.title: The enterprise AI land grab is on. Glean is building the layer beneath the interface.
entries.content: In this week's episode of the Equity podcast, Glean CEO Arvind Jain explains the company's shift from enterprise search tool to middleware layer for enterprise AI.
entries.author: Rebecca Bellan

entries.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Rivian’s savior
entries.content: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.
entries.author: Kirsten Korosec

entries.title: What the Epstein files reveal about EV startups and Silicon Valley
entries.content: Will the Epstein revelations lead to broader fallout in Silicon Valley?
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: How to get into a16z’s super-competitive Speedrun startup accelerator program
entries.content: TechCrunch spoke to a16z partner Joshua Lu for some tips on standing out for the Speedrun program.
entries.author: Dominic-Madori Davis

entries.title: Hollywood isn’t happy about the new Seedance 2.0 video generator
entries.content: Hollywood organizations are pushing back against a new AI video model called Seedance 2.0, which they say has quickly become a tool for “blatant” copyright infringement.
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: The great computer science exodus (and where students are going instead)
entries.content: Students are losing some interest in computer science broadly but gaining interest in AI-specific majors and courses.
entries.author: Connie Loizos

entries.title: Homeland Security reportedly sent hundreds of subpoenas seeking to unmask anti-ICE accounts
entries.content: The Department of Homeland Security has been increasing pressure on tech companies to identify the owners of accounts that criticize ICE.
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: Is safety ‘dead’ at xAI?
entries.content: Elon Musk is “actively” working to make xAI’s Grok chatbot “more unhinged, according to a former employee.
entries.author: Anthony Ha

entries.title: In a changed VC landscape, this exec is doubling down on overlooked founders
entries.content: As much of Silicon Valley chases mega-rounds and buzzy AI deals, Stacy Brown-Philpot is running Cherryrock Capital like a throwback to venture capital's earlier days
entries.author: Connie Loizos

entries.title: ‘Clueless’ -inspired app Alta partners with brand Public School to start integrating styling tools into websites
entries.content: This week, Alta unveiled its first integration collaboration, teaming up with Public School, a storied New York City brand.
entries.author: Dominic-Madori Davis

entries.title: Designer Kate Barton teams up with IBM and Fiducia AI for a NYFW presentation
entries.content: Designer Kate Barton teams up with Fiducia AI and IBM for a NYFW presentation.
entries.author: Dominic-Madori Davis

entries.title: India doubles down on state-backed venture capital, approving $1.1B fund
entries.content: India’s $1.1B fund-of-funds will invest through private VCs to support deep-tech and manufacturing startups.
entries.author: Jagmeet Singh

entries.title: Nothing opens its first retail store in India
entries.content: The two-story location will sell products from Nothing and the more affordable, mass-market brand CMF.
entries.author: Ivan Mehta

entries.title: Indian pharmacy chain giant exposed customer data and internal systems
entries.content: A backend flaw in web admin dashboards used by one of India's largest pharmacy chains, exposed thousands of online pharmacy orders.
entries.author: Jagmeet Singh
